intro: Pithecellobium domingense, commonly known as the Dominican acacia, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, edible pods that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
